com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app

Class SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<ContextClass>
      • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands.AbstractSimpleGuardedCommand<android.app.Activity>
        • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand
          • com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app.SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SmartCommands.GuardedHandler, java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    SmartCommands

    public abstract static class SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand
extends SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand
    A handy SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand which will issue systematically dismiss a Dialog once the command execution is over.

    This kind of command is especially useful when a ProgressDialog is being displayed just before the current command execution, and that it should be dismissed at the end of its execution.

    Since:
    2011.11.03

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected android.app.Dialog dialog
      The dialog box which will be dismissed by the current command.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand(android.app.Activity context, java.lang.Object component, java.lang.String warningLogMessage, int warningDisplayMessageResourceId, android.app.Dialog dialog)
      Same as SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand#ProgressDialogGuardedCommand(Context, Object, String, String, Dialog) with the fourth parameter equal to context.getString(warningDisplayMessageResourceId).
      SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand(android.app.Activity context, java.lang.Object component, java.lang.String warningLogMessage, java.lang.String warningDisplayMessage, android.app.Dialog dialog)
      Creates a new SmartCommands.GuardedCommand, which will issue a warning log and then trigger a SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand, if an exception occurs during its execution, and eventually dismiss the provided dialog.
      SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand(android.app.Activity context, java.lang.String warningLogMessage, int warningDisplayMessageResourceId, android.app.Dialog dialog)
      Same as SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand#ProgressDialogGuardedCommand(Context, String, String, Dialog) with the second argument set to null.

      • SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand

      • SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand

        public SmartCommands.DialogGuardedCommand(android.app.Activity context,
                                  java.lang.Object component,
                                  java.lang.String warningLogMessage,
                                  java.lang.String warningDisplayMessage,
                                  android.app.Dialog dialog)
        Creates a new SmartCommands.GuardedCommand, which will issue a warning log and then trigger a SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand, if an exception occurs during its execution, and eventually dismiss the provided dialog.
        Parameters:
        context - the context from which the execution originates, and which will be used when reporting a potential exception ; it is not allowed to be
        component - the component from which the execution originates, and which will be used when reporting a potential exception ; may be @{code null}
        warningLogMessage - the log message that will be output in case of exception
        warningDisplayMessage - the (supposedly i18ned) human readable that will be transfered to the SmartCommands.GuardedException in case of exception during the command execution
        dialog - the dialog to be dismissed at the end of the command execution ; may be null, and in that case, just behaves as its parent SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand
        See Also:
        SmartCommands.SimpleGuardedCommand#SimpleGuardedCommand(Context, String, String)

    • Method Detail

      • runGuardedDialog

        protected abstract void runGuardedDialog()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        The actual command method to implement.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something wrong happened during the command execution

      • runGuarded

        protected final void runGuarded()
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        The implementation will invoke the runGuardedDialog() method, and will eventually dismiss the dialog if necessary, whatever happens.
        Specified by:
        runGuarded in class SmartCommands.GuardedCommand<android.app.Activity>
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - the method allows an exception to be thrown, and will be appropriately caught by the ActivityController#handleException(Activity, Throwable) method
        See Also:
        SmartCommands.GuardedCommand.runGuarded()
